1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: I knew that so the truth: and how shall man be just with God?

3.text: If he shall desire to contend with him, he shall not answer him one from a thousand.

4.text: Wise of heart and strong of power: who was hard before him and shall be requited?

5.text: Removing the mountains and they knew not: who overturned them in his anger;

6.text: Moving the earth from her place, and her pillars will tremble;

7.text: Saying to the sun, and it shall not rise; and for the stars he will seal them up.

8.text: He alone spread out the heavens and he trod upon the heights of the sea.

9.text: He made Ash-Chesil and Cimah, and the chambers of the south;

10.text: He did great things even not searched out; and wonders even no number.

11.text: Behold, he will pass by me, and I shall not see: and he will glide on and I shall not understand for him.

12.text: Behold, he will catch and who shall turn him? and who shall say to him, What wilt thou do?

13.text: God will not turn back his anger, the helpers of pride bowed down under him.

14.text: How much less shall I answer him, shall I choose my words with him?

15.text: Whom, if I was just, I shall not answer; I will make supplication to my judge.

16.text: If I called and he will answer me, I shall not believe that he will give ear to my voice.

17.text: Who will assail me with tempest, and he multiplied my wounds without cause.

18.text: He will not give me to draw in my spirit, for he will fill me with bitterness.

19.text: If for strength, behold him strong: if for judgment, who shall arraign me.

20.text: If I shall be just, my mouth shall condemn me: I am blameless, and he will declare me perverse.

21.text: I am blameless, I shall not know my soul: I shall despise my life.

22.text: It is one: for this, I said, The blameless one and the unjust one he finishes.

23.text: If the scourge shall fall suddenly, he will deride at the trial of the innocent.

24.text: The earth was given into the hand of the unjust one: he will cover the faces of her judges; if not now, who is it?

25.text: My days were swift above a runner: they fled, they saw not good.

26.text: They glided along with the ships of desire: as the eagle will pounce upon food.

27.text: If my saying, I will forget my complaint, I will let go my face, and I will be cheerful:

28.text: I was afraid of all my pains, I knew that thou wilt not acquit me.

29.text: Shall I do evil, wherefore this shall I labor in vain?

30.text: If I washed myself in snow-water, and cleansed my hands clean;

31.text: Then thou wilt immerse me in the ditch, and my garments abhorred me.

32.text: For not a man as I; I shall answer him, we shall come together in judgment.

33.text: There is not between us a reprover; he will put his hand upon us two.

34.text: He will take away his rod from me, and his truth shall not make me afraid.

35.text: I will speak, and I shall not fear him; but not so am I with myself.
